Creating Auditory Displays with Multiple Loudspeakers Using

front.div:
Abstract
Auditory displays containing an arbitrary number of loudspeakers in any positioning are created. The sound signals
are positioned to the display using Vector Base Amplitude Panning (VBAP). The VBAP method is reviewed and a
new automatic loudspeaker setup division routine is presented. The VBAP is used to create auditory display to the
Digital Interactive Virtual Acoustics (DIVA) virtual environment system.
